text: The 1931–32 season was the 59th season of competitive football in Scotland and the 42nd season of the Scottish Football League. == Scottish League Division One == Champions: Motherwell Relegated: Dundee United, Leith Athletic == Scottish League Division Two == Promoted: East Stirlingshire, St. Johnstone == Scottish Cup == Rangers were winners of the Scottish Cup after a 3–0 replay win over Kilmarnock. == Other Honours == === National === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner- up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup - North |Inverness Citadel |4 – 1 |Murrayfield Amateurs |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup - South |Beith |6 – 1 |Dalbeattie Star |} === County === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Aberdeen |11 – 3 * |Huntly |- |align=left|Dumbartonshire Cup |Dumbarton |8 – 3 * |Vale Ocaba |- |align=left|East of Scotland Shield |Hearts |5 – 1 |St Bernard's |- |align=left|Fife Cup |East Fife |3 – 1 |Cowdenbeath |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Montrose |1 – 0 |Dundee United |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Rangers |3 – 0 |Queens Park |- |align=left|Lanarkshire Cup |Motherwell |5 – 4 * |Airdrie |- |align=left|Perthshire Cup |St Johnstone |9 – 0 |Binham Rovers |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |St Mirren |5 – 2 * |Morton |- |align=left|Southern Counties Cup |Stranraer | | |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |East Stirling |4 – 2 |Stenhousemuir |} \- aggregate over two legs === Highland League === == Junior Cup == Glasgow Perthshire were winners of the Junior Cup after a 2–1 win over Kirkintilloch Rob Roy in the final. == Scotland national team == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |19 September 1931 |Ibrox Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|3–1 |BHC |George Stevenson, Jimmy McGrory, Bob McPhail |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |31 October 1931 |Racecourse Ground, Wrexham (A) | |align=center|3–2 |BHC |George Stevenson, Robert Thomson, Jimmy McGrory |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |9 April 1932 |Wembley Stadium, London (A) | |align=center|0–3 |BHC | |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |8 May 1932 |Stade de Colombes Paris (A) | |align=center|3–1 |Friendly |Neil Dewar (3) |- |} Key: * (H) = Home match * (A) = Away match * BHC = British Home Championship == References == == External links == * Scottish Football Historical Archive
title: 1931–32 in Scottish football
